basics.name: Salvatore Milite
basics.label: PhD Student in Computational Biology
basics.summary:
*“Better to have analyzed and lost than never to have analyzed the data at all. (A. Gelman)”*

I am a graduate student in computational biology with a background in data science and
scientific computing. I am passionate about probabilistic models, deep learning, and cancer genomics.
Currently, I am focusing on developing deep generative models to integrate single-cell
multi-omics data.

work.name: Human Technopole
work.description: [Human Technopole](https://humantechnopole.it/it/) is an Italian research institute focused on life sciences, aiming to improve human health through advanced research in genomics, neurobiology, and other scientific areas.
work.summary: As a Bioinformatics Scientists I have:
highlights: Developed a Bayesian Clustering method to perform subclonal deconvolution from whole-genome sequencing, using Stochastic Variational Inference, PyTorch and Pyro.
Developed a pipeline to flag and quantify tumor contamination in healthy biopsies.
Worked in developing a tool to perform quality control of copy-number alteration inference from whole-genome sequencing data.

work.name: Technical University of Munich
work.summary: As a Research Assistant, I have Analyzed dozens of scRNA-seq datasets from mouse Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma (PDAC) models.
